[{"id":"QCT-1497","entityId":"66-5514","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Unchecking Support open AMIP in setup file should disable Open AMIP settings in modem settings"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"created","value":"1588871947078"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1497"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589208188772"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1127","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"gma","fullName":"Govan Marounsi"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["480"],"valueId":["1d"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1502","entityId":"66-5526","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Q-lite setup file - not possible to select modem parameters"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Jonas Lindberg"},{"name":"created","value":"1589200146119"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1502"},{"name":"description","value":"

1.7 RC4
if a q-light setup file is used. the modem parameters under ADMIN is not possible to select. The display becomes blank and box witch "web server started" is shown.
If L-band setup file is used - then ok.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"jln"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1589205262539"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.7"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.7"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"vse","fullName":"Viktor Selleby"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-6296","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"QCT-1502","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1589205189563,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Star","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"QCT-1480","entityId":"66-5475","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Add OpenAmip signal level to Tuning page"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktor Selleby"},{"name":"created","value":"1588590957713"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1480"},{"name":"description","value":"

Find out which limits shall apply. Suitable persons to talk to is Mikael Borin or Fredrik Jonsson. These temperature limits shall be the ones reported from the mainboard sensors since we don't get any temperatures from the modem.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1587559591960"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"QCT-1137","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"QCT-923","type":"Depend","role":"depends on"},{"value":"QCT-1164","type":"Depend","role":"depends on"}]},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["feature-QCT-1137"],"valueId":["feature-QCT-1137"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5603","author":"gma","authorFullName":"Govan Marounsi","issueId":"QCT-1165","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1586790958690,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Release Notes","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"QCT-1108","entityId":"66-3529","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Not possible to downgrade database"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1536225263448"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1108"},{"name":"description","value":"
This means that it will not be possible to install a previous version where the database version is less than the current one.

For instance, in 1.4 the database version is 4. In 1.5 the version will be 5. So it will be possible to upgrade from 1.4 to 1.5 but not downgrade from 1.5 to 1.4.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"boj"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1586457490103"},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Unimpeded"],"valueId":["Unimpeded"],"color":{"bg":"#409600","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.4"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.4"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"boj","fullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"}]},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["120"],"valueId":["2h"],"color":null}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1279","entityId":"66-4095","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Admin Tool / SW upgrade / No confirmation after reboot"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Mikael Borin"},{"name":"created","value":"1559140027438"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1279"},{"name":"description","value":"
In the Admin Tool after a SW upgrade, there is no confirmation after reboot.
The reason is that the M&C IP address has been set to default and the web server is stopped.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Govan Marounsi"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"mbo"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"gma"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1586457381230"},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["2020_qct_1_7"],"valueId":["2020_qct_1_7"],"color":null},{"name":"Planned Release","value":["1.6.0"],"valueId":["1.6.0"],"color":null},{"name":"QCT Branch","value":["maintenance-1.6"],"valueId":["maintenance-1.6"],"color":null},{"name":"Estimated Effort","value":["960"],"valueId":["2d"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5956","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-1279","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
After we reinstall a unit and reboots, the OS thinks it is starting for the first time and cleans all data files, including our databases and configuration files.

We need to send a question to Hectronic regarding this behaviour.

Also, we can't reproduce this on our lab boards. We need help from Magnus Andersson to build a new lab board with a recent main boards.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1567522994488,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"QCT-1105","entityId":"66-3520","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"Port BuzzerPort from Master to maintenance/1.4"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Bengt-Ove Johansson"},{"name":"created","value":"1535978669501"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"1105"},{"name":"description","value":"
Buzzer does not work in the emulator in 1.4. BuzzerPort is a fix for that but it was introduced in master.

Johansson"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-5127","author":"mbo","authorFullName":"Mikael Borin","issueId":"QCT-908","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Add the following in the Setup under general Satellite information after the Longitude parameter:
  • Beacon Downlink Frequency [Hz]
  • Beacon Downlink Polarization [V/H/RHCP/LHCP]

Calculate the corresponding Uplink Polarization on the Transceiver for reception of the Beacon carrier. Display the Tx Polarization for data traffic and for the Beacon Carrier on the Histogram page.

Automatically adjust the Ku-band LO frequency to be able to receive the beacon carrier. The Ku-band frequency ranges for the different LO frequencies are:
Voltage: 13 / 15 / 18 V
LO: 9.75 / 10.35 / 11.05 GHz
L-band: 10.7 - <11.3 / 11.3 - <12.0 / 12.0 - 12.75 GHz
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1504699223096,"updated":1504763190535,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-5128","author":"boj","authorFullName":"Bengt-Ove Johansson","issueId":"QCT-908","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Moved the above information into subtasks.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1504703108624,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Release Notes","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"QCT-638","entityId":"66-2299","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"QCT"},{"name":"summary","value":"POE always on"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Peter Bladh"},{"name":"created","value":"1452774542687"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"638"},{"name":"description","value":"
Power Over Ethernet shall always be on.
"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Peter Bladh"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"peb"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"5"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"peb"},{"name":"markdown","value":"false"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1454998322987"},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Minor"],"valueId":["Minor"],"color":{"bg":"#e6e6e6","fg":"#888"}},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Blocked","value":["Blocked"],"valueId":["Blocked"],"color":{"bg":"#8d5100","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Sprint","value":["QCT Don't do now"],"valueId":["QCT Don't do now"],"color":null},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"QCT-638.patch","id":"85-637","url":"http://dps-sw-youtrack.corp.datapath.com:8999/_persistent/QCT-638.patch?file=85-637&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"83-4130","author":"peb","authorFullName":"Peter Bladh","issueId":"QCT-638","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Probably not ok.

My conclusion is that PoE is turned on during boot, but is turned off when the QCT-SW starts.

Test Setup:
  • Bräda@DVI (which is the second revision "R2" with the DIP-switches for PoE) with attached ethernet connector to J8
  • Office phone (Cisco)

Performed test
1) Connect the Office phone to J8 before the QCT-device is powered on.
  • > Some of the buttons is turned for about a second (BIT-test?)
It does not start successfully. It looks powered off after a few seconds.

2) Connect the Office phone to J8 when the QCT-SW has started on the QCT-device.
  • > Nothing happens. It looks like the phone never gets any power.
This is tested for all four combinations of the two DIP-switches.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1453875894054,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"83-4131","author":"peb","authorFullName":"Peter Bladh","issueId":"QCT-638","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Changed Priority from Criticla to Normal since current QCT-version (L-band) does not have any outside connector for PoE. (the only network connector on the unit is the M&C for the QCT mainboard)

If the problem is related to Hectronic it might be good to try to fix this for the 1.0 release of QCT-SW (before they forget what QCT is all about :) )
